page.title: 06EDUCATION - VILLAGE SCHOOL.
page.content: {Burley Woodhead school}opened in 1860. Although it was put on the closure list in 1944 it didn't close until 1976. The school closed because it was too small and the old heating system made it too costly to run. In the winter the school was very cold because the only heating the school had was three radiators and a boiler. The school room was one big room which was used for assemblies and dinner times. When the lessons started a screen was pulled across to divide the room into two parts;two thirds for the older children and one third for the younger children. There were also five toilets,three for the girls and two for the boys. These buildings were out in the courtyard.
